Description: Scaraboid made of faience, with a roughly rectangular ground shape, the back is curved, the base flat. Few traces of the glazing is preserved inside the signs of the base, whitish colour. The back shows traces of an original carving of some sort of an animal(?) or decorative pattern, but the stage is preservation is so bad that no identification is possible anymore. The seal at the base shows three very crude cut signs, on the left a seated deity facing to the right, on top of a possible nb-sign, in front of both an unspecific oval sign. Perforated along its longitudinal side.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), west lane outside D14.16C
